data.title: London Stansted Airport STN: Help & Info Guide
data.meta_description: Guide to London Stansted Airport: STN Maps, Flight Status, Airlines, Food, Security Wait Times, Parking, Transport, Connection Times, Help & Tips...
data.text:
Picking Up and Dropping Off Passengers

The airport offers several options for picking up and dropping off passengers. If you are dropping off a passenger, you can use the designated drop-off zones located outside the terminal building. However, please note that there is a strict time limit of 10 minutes for drop-offs, and you are not allowed to leave your vehicle unattended. If you need more time, you can use the short-stay car park, which is located within walking distance of the terminal.

If you are picking up a passenger, you can use the designated pick-up zones located outside the terminal building. However, please note that there is no waiting allowed in the pick-up zones, and you must be ready to pick up your passenger as soon as they arrive. If you need to wait for your passenger, you can use the free cell-phone waiting area, which is located just a few minutes away from the terminal. This area allows you to wait in your car until your passenger is ready to be picked up.

It is important to note that curbside parking is strictly prohibited at Stansted, and vehicles parked illegally will be towed away. Therefore, it is recommended to use the designated drop-off and pick-up zones or the short-stay car park to avoid any inconvenience.

Parking Facilities & Options

London Stansted Airport offers a variety of parking options to suit the needs of every traveler. The airport has several parking lots and garages located within walking distance of the terminals. There are also cell phone waiting areas available for those waiting to pick up arriving passengers.

For travelers with disabilities, designated handicapped parking spots are available in all parking areas. These spots are conveniently located near the terminal entrances and shuttle bus stops.

If you're looking for a more economical option, off-airport parking is available. These parking lots offer shuttle service to and from the airport and often have lower rates than on-airport parking.

Get details about Stansted Airport parking options and rates, along with more economical off-airport parking here.

Transportation Options

STN offers a variety of ground transportation options for travelers.

Car rental facilities are available at the airport, with major providers such as Avis, Hertz, and Europcar offering services. These providers have their offices located in the Car Rental Village, which is a short shuttle bus ride from the terminal.

Taxi services are also available at the airport, with designated drop-off areas located outside the terminal building. The fares for taxi services are metered and vary depending on the destination.

Shared ride services, such as Uber and Lyft, are available at the airport with designated pickup areas located outside the terminal building. However, it is important to note that there are restrictions on the types of vehicles that can enter the airport premises.

Airport shuttles are available for travelers who want to travel to nearby destinations. These shuttles provide a convenient and affordable way to travel, with pickup areas located outside the terminal building. The fares for airport shuttles vary depending on the destination.

Public transportation options are also available for travelers. The Stansted Express train service provides a direct link between the airport and London Liverpool Street station, with trains departing every 15 minutes. There are also bus services available from the airport to nearby destinations.

Airport Hotels

Are you looking for the perfect place to rest before an early flight or a comfortable base for exploring the surrounding area? We have compiled a list of the best hotel options that offer a unique blend of convenience, comfort, and excellent amenities. From modern hotels like Hampton By Hilton to charming accommodations like the Old Thatch Bambers Green, there's something for every traveler's taste and budget. These hotels offer a range of amenities including on-site dining options, private parking, and easy access to transportation options. Some are just a short stroll from the airport terminal, while others are situated in quaint towns nearby, offering a taste of English charm and history. Ready to explore your options? Check out our comprehensive list of Stansted Airport Hotels now!

Dining, Shopping & Enjoying the Airport

STN Airport offers a wide variety of dining options and shopping experiences to make your journey more enjoyable. Some of the most popular restaurants include Giraffe, JD Wetherspoon, Pret A Manger, and Starbucks. And when it comes to shopping, be sure to check out Glorious Britain, World Duty Free, Boots, and WHSmith. Of course, this is just a sample of what's available. For a complete list of restaurants, bars, shops, and news stands, discover what's available here.

Passenger Services

STN Airport is committed to providing passengers with a comfortable and stress-free travel experience. Here are some of the services available to passengers:

Wifi access is available throughout the airport, allowing passengers to stay connected during their journey.

The lost and found office is located in the main terminal, and passengers can report lost items or inquire about lost items there.

Children's areas are available in the main terminal and Terminal A, providing a safe and fun space for young travelers to play and relax before their flight.

Special-needs services are available upon request, including wheelchair assistance, accessible parking, and accessible restrooms.

Banking services are available in the main terminal, with ATMs and currency exchange available for passengers.

Medical help is available in the main terminal, with a medical center staffed by trained professionals. In case of emergency, passengers should notify airport staff immediately.

Flight Status Info

As an air traveler, it's important to stay updated on the status of your flight departure. At the airport, there are several ways to check for flight updates.

One way is to use the in-airport flight displays (FIDS) located throughout the terminal. These displays provide real-time information on flight departures, delays, and gate information.

Another way is to download your airline's mobile phone app. Most airlines offer apps that allow passengers to receive alerts about departure delays, cancelations, or gate changes via text, email, and push notifications.

Passengers can also check the status of their flight departure at Stansted by visiting the flight departures page on ifly.com, which provides real-time updates on flight departures, delays, and gate information.

Helpful Tips

When to Arrive

It is recommended to arrive at STN Airport at least 2 hours before your flight departure time for domestic flights and 3 hours for international flights. This will allow you enough time to check-in, go through security, and find your gate. The busiest times at the airport are typically early mornings and late afternoons, so it is best to avoid those times if possible.

Getting to the Airport

There are several ways to get to the airport. The easiest and most convenient way is by train. The Stansted Express runs every 15 minutes from London Liverpool Street station and takes approximately 45 minutes to reach the airport. There are also several bus services that operate to and from the airport, including National Express and Terravision. Taxis and private car hire services are also available.

Getting Oriented

To get oriented at Stansted, you can use the interactive airport maps available on the iFly.com website. These maps allow you to view the layout of the airport, locate your gate, and find amenities such as restaurants and shops. You can also download the airport's official app, which provides real-time flight information, maps, and other helpful features.

Avoiding Delays

To avoid delays at London Stansted Airport, make sure to arrive early and allow enough time for check-in and security. It is also a good idea to check your flight status before leaving for the airport, as delays and cancellations can occur. Additionally, be sure to follow all airport rules and regulations, such as restrictions on liquids and electronics in carry-on luggage, to avoid any delays during the security screening process.

Airport Facts & Stats

London Stansted Airport is located in the United Kingdom and is one of the busiest airports in the country. It has a total of four terminals including the Main Terminal, Terminal A, Terminal B, and Terminal C. The airport is situated about 42 miles away from central London and is easily accessible via public transportation.

On average, Stansted Airport handles around 25,000 passengers daily and operates approximately 600 flights per day. The airport serves over 200 destinations worldwide, making it a popular choice for both business and leisure travelers.

The top airlines with the most daily flights from STN include Ryanair, easyJet, Jet2.com, and British Airways. These airlines offer a wide range of domestic and international flights, connecting passengers to popular destinations across Europe and beyond.

The top 5 destinations served by STN Airport are Dublin, Barcelona, Amsterdam, Belfast, and Madrid. These cities are popular among travelers for their rich history, culture, and entertainment options.

The airport is also a hub for several airlines including Ryanair, which operates over 150 routes from the airport, and Jet2.com, which offers flights to over 50 destinations from London Stansted.

Airport History

Stansted, located in Essex, England, is one of the busiest airports in the United Kingdom. It was originally built in 1942 as a Royal Air Force base during World War II. After the war, the airport was used for commercial flights, and in 1966, it was purchased by the British Airports Authority.

Here are some significant events in the airport's history:

In 1991, the airport was privatized and sold to the Manchester Airports Group.

In 1995, a new terminal building was opened, increasing the airport's capacity to 15 million passengers per year.

In 2003, a new runway was opened, allowing the airport to handle more flights and larger aircraft.

In 2013, the airport was sold to the M.A.G. Stansted Limited consortium.

In 2018, the airport celebrated its 25th anniversary of being a privatized airport.

Today, London Stansted Airport serves over 28 million passengers per year, with flights to over 200 destinations around the world.

Stansted Airport has a rich history and continues to be an important hub for air travel in the United Kingdom.
